questions.text: Cossack, old, opera, panama, pork-pie, ten-gallon
questions.explanation:
Hat & hat.

	Opera hat, panama hat etc.

Pie & pie.

	Cottage pie, mince pie etc.

questions.text: Evening, falling, film, north, pole, shooting
questions.explanation:
Star & star.

	Film star, north star, shooting star etc. Falling star is an informal name for a meteor. Evening star is a planet, usually Venus, seen shining brightly in the west just after sunset.

Suit & suit.

	Birthday suit, boiler suit, trouser suit etc.

questions.text: Bath, deck, easy, electric, swivel, rocking
questions.explanation:
Chair & chair.

	Bath chair, deck chair, easy chair etc.

Wire & wire.

	Live wire, chicken wire, high wire etc.

Agent & agent.

	Double agent, secret agent, free agent etc. Oxidizing can also be spelt as oxidising. All those hours doing chemistry did come in useful after all.

Bag & bag.

	Cool bag, sleeping bag, grow bag etc.

Bar & bar.

	Coffee bar, single's bar, snack bar etc.

Block & block.

	Breeze block, mental block, starting block

Canal & canal.

	Alimentary canal, Grand canal, Suez canal etc.

Box & box.

	Pillar box, Christmas box, fuse box etc.

China & china.

	Bone china, Communist China, Dresden china etc.

Glass & glass.

	Cut glass, safety glass, stained glass etc.

Holiday & holiday.

	Bank holiday, busman's holiday, public holiday etc. A Roman holiday is entertainment or pleasure that depends on the suffering of others. Not a lot of people know that including me. A busman's holiday is a holiday spent doing the same sort of thing as one does at work.

Garden & garden.

	Market garden, rock garden, tea garden etc.

Time & time.

	Local time, double time, Father time etc.

Black & black.

	All black, jet black, penny black etc.

Moon & moon.

	Blue moon, full moon, harvest moon etc.

Chip & chip.

	Blue chip, potato chip, silicon chip, etc. Blue chip is a gambling chip of the highest value or a reliable stock in the financial world.

Pear & pear.

	Alligator pear or avocado, Conference pear, prickly pear. The prickly pear is a tropical cactus or its fruit.

Whistle & whistle.

	Penny whistle, tin whistle, wolf whistle etc. The tin whistle is another name for the penny whistle.

Sickness & sickness.

	Morning sickness, motion sickness, radiation sickness etc. Decompression sickness caused by a sudden change in atmospheric pressure similar to deep-sea divers experiencing 'The Bends'

Screw & screw.

	Archimedes screw, grub screw, Phillip's screw. The Archimedes screw is an ancient type of water-lifting device where the water is raised when the spiral is rotated.

Chamber & chamber.

	Cloud chamber, gas chamber, ionization chamber etc. Hope you enjoyed the quiz. If you found it too easy or enjoyed it then try one of the other 27 Quizzical quizzes.
